intro: Leptostachya debilis, commonly known as the slender lepidostachya, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with delicate, pale green to white flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
